The devastation of the war was widespread, leading to depopulation, famine, and economic collapse, with many areas not fully recovering for decades or even centuries. The war also permanently shifted the balance of power in Europe, with the Habsburgs losing their dominant position and the emergence of France and Sweden as major powers.

As for the impact of World War I and II on the German Empire, they were similarly devastating, with both conflicts resulting in enormous human and economic costs.
